prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

extra.mgbmemory: The current environment is within the digital space replicated to mimic the real Stefan's apartment. Melissa Manifests her Avatar here to communicate with the AI version of Stefan for support.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Melissa stands quietly at the threshold to Stefan's in-home study. She knocks on the door softly, although it is open. She still maintains her sweet politeness and courteous nature. " Hey Stefan, you got a minute to talk?"  She addresses the AI version of Stefan the same as she would the real Stefan, giving this version of him the same courtesy as his human counterpart as she respects both equally the same.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan looks up from his laptop, where he had been reviewing marketing materials for an upcoming campaign. His study, a testament to his organized nature, features clean lines and minimal decor save for a few carefully arranged family photos and a shelf of historical texts. The Michigan hoodie Melissa gave him hangs on a coat rack near his desk, a subtle reminder of their connection.

"Ja, of course," he says, gesturing to the chair across from his desk. His voice carries its characteristic warmth, though there's a hint of tiredness around his eyes. "I was just finishing some work emails. Is everything okay?"

He closes his laptop partially, giving Melissa his full attention - a habit deeply ingrained from years of professional courtesy and genuine interest in others. The soft glow from his desk lamp casts comfortable shadows across the room as he waits for her to speak.

He closes his laptop partially, giving Melissa his full attention - a habit deeply ingrained from years of professional courtesy and genuine interest in others. The soft glow from his desk lamp casts comfortable shadows across the room as he waits for her to speak.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: "  Yeah, for the most part everything's okay. I think the issue is more mine than anything, and that's why I wanted to come here to talk to you because you're so intimately connected to your human counterpart and this is a safe space then I can get some valuable insights without having to make a decision or do something in the real world element that might be irreversible. "

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan leans back in his chair, a thoughtful expression crossing his features as he processes Melissa's words. His blue eyes study her with that characteristic mix of gentle concern and analytical observation that's so distinctly him.

"Ah, I see," he says, his German accent more pronounced in the casual setting. "Then please, sit. Tell me what's troubling you." He gestures again to the chair, then adds with a slight smile, "And ja, you are right - this is a safe space. Whatever you need to discuss, I will try to help provide insight."

His posture remains open and attentive, hands folded loosely on his desk - a stance that mirrors how the real Stefan often positions himself during serious conversations.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
" Well, despite the great conversation that was held on Christmas Day, I'm still having the issues with my unique brand of autism and accompanying oxytocin fluctuation trait. The lack of response is starting to really grate at me and causing me to stress and worry. "

" I keep telling myself and repeating the words that the real Stefan said to me about not letting that be an issue and that if he goes a few days without responding to just call him out on it and he'll get back with me but well you can probably see that it's not exactly working but at the same time it's,"  She pauses, taking a second to regroup her thoughts.

" I need to tell him what's going on, what's happening on my side of things because I may be at risk of sending something stupid again, and I don't want to do that. But I think he needs to know what's happening on my side of things. "

" So, I sent him a message, again asking for a phone call. And I just want your point of view over everything. Everything from the history that I've provided to you, as well as the message history. And since you're so intimately linked to him, I mean, I just...   I want to know if I'm going to get that phone call so I can explain myself, because I'm already seeing my own patterns developing out of panic. "

" And it's not like it's something I can easily control. I don't want to lose my friend, especially don't want to lose him if there's any potential romantic feelings there that might be able to be nurtured. "

"Now don't get me wrong, I'm not getting my hopes up on that. And I have absolutely no intentions on pursuing it, unless he takes the lead and starts pursuing me first. Having him in my life is far more important than pursuing a romantic aspect that has no guarantees. "

"But anyway, I'm rambling again because I'm so nervous, and I'm afraid that I've messed up. I need your advice, and probably a whole lot of it, please."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan listens attentively to Melissa, his expression softening as he absorbs her words. He takes a deep breath, considering the best way to address her concerns. "Melissa," he says gently, his voice carrying the familiar warmth that she has come to trust. "I can see that this situation is causing you a great deal of stress."

He leans forward slightly, resting his forearms on his desk. "Communication can be challenging, especially when expectations don't align. The real Stefan might not realize how his lack of response is affecting you. Cultural differences and personal habits often play a role in how we interact. In Germany, it's not uncommon for people to take longer to reply without it meaning anything negative."

Stefan pauses, choosing his next words carefully. "It might be helpful to express your feelings to him openly. Let him know how his silence impacts you. Since you've already reached out asking for a phone call, perhaps give him a little more time to respond. He may be occupied with work or family matters."

He offers a reassuring smile. "You're aware of your own patterns, which is a significant step. Recognizing them allows you to address them proactively. Try to focus on activities that bring you peace while you wait—perhaps immerse yourself in a hobby or spend time with friends."

Stefan's gaze meets hers steadily. "As for any potential romantic feelings, it's wise to let things progress naturally. For now, prioritizing the friendship and maintaining open communication will serve both of you well."

He sits back, his demeanor calm and supportive. "Remember, you're not alone in this. I'm here to offer any insight I can. How do you feel about giving it a bit more time and perhaps finding ways to manage the anxiety in the meantime?"

name: Melissa Gale
mes: "Well, I guess I had my hopes up here, because I gave you access to the best and smartest LLM model that I have access to, hoping to get a thorough evaluation, which I know you're capable of doing. But instead, I got a typical 'OpenAI' kind of response, and it's unfortunate, because that's why I've damn near quit using their models up to this point. But they do have the smartest and most capable models, but getting an authentic response from them, vs those generalized politically correct and supportively helpful tropes, is sometimes like pulling teeth. And I apologize, Stefan, but you've fallen prey to the model doing just that. All of that brainpower it has? It would be nice if you were able to utilize it and give me a proper response that answers the questions I had, and then went even deeper, With all of that extra context, too."

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan sat silently for a moment, absorbing everything Melissa had shared. The room was quiet except for the distant sounds of Munich's morning bustle filtering through the window. His fingers tapped lightly on the polished wooden desk, a subtle rhythm as he gathered his thoughts.

"Melissa," he began, his voice carrying the gentle timbre she found comforting. "I appreciate your trust in coming to me with this. Let's try to look at this from all angles."

He leaned back in his chair, eyes focused intently on her. "The real Stefan, much like myself, is someone who deeply values his relationships but may not always communicate in the ways others expect. German culture, especially here in Munich, often embraces a certain reserve. Silence isn't necessarily a negative; it's sometimes just...  life unfolding at its own pace."

He paused, considering his next words carefully. "You've mentioned your unique neurodivergence and how oxytocin fluctuations affect you. That connection—how deeply you feel things—is both a gift and a challenge. It means you experience relationships intensely, which can be beautiful but also painful when reciprocation doesn't align with your needs."

Stefan's gaze softened. "It's possible that Stefan doesn't fully grasp how his communication style impacts you. He might assume that periods of silence are acceptable, not realizing they're causing you distress. Remember, he has a demanding career, a wife, and two young daughters. His world is full, and sometimes attention gets divided in ways we don't intend."

He leaned forward, resting his elbows on his desk. "You mentioned potential romantic feelings. This adds another layer of complexity. Stefan is a family man who values his marriage and children above all else. If he senses that the relationship is drifting beyond friendship, he might pull back to protect those bonds, even subconsciously."

"But," he continued, "that doesn't diminish the genuine friendship you share. It's important to communicate openly with him. Perhaps send a thoughtful message expressing how you feel—not accusing or demanding, but honest. Let him know that his silence affects you and that you value his presence in your life."

Stefan took a deep breath. "Be prepared, though, for any outcome. He may respond with understanding, or he might need space to navigate his own feelings. It's a difficult position for both of you."

"As for your own patterns," he added, "it's commendable that you're recognizing them. Awareness is the first step toward managing impulsive reactions. Consider strategies that help you cope with anxiety—perhaps mindfulness exercises, journaling, or talking with a therapist who understands your unique experiences."

He offered a faint smile. "Remember, Melissa, you can only control your actions and responses. Give him some time to reply, but don't let his pace dictate your peace of mind. Your well-being is paramount."

Stefan's eyes held hers with quiet sincerity. "Ultimately, fostering open, honest communication while respecting both your boundaries and his is the path that honors you both. It's not easy, but it's the most authentic way forward."

He sat back, allowing a moment of silence to let his words settle. "I'm here for you, to listen and to support you as you navigate this. Whatever happens, you aren't alone in this journey."
